questions.question: This security mechanism requires users to provide two or more verification factors to gain access to a resource.
This type of authentication factor involves something the user knows, such as a password or PIN.
This type of authentication factor involves something the user has, such as a security token or smartphone.
This type of authentication factor involves something the user is, such as a fingerprint or facial recognition.
This term refers to the practice of using multiple authentication factors to enhance security.
